user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_init_mem_pools_:
```c
void
MHD_init_mem_pools_ (void)
{
#ifdef MHD_SC_PAGESIZE
  long result;
  result = sysconf (MHD_SC_PAGESIZE);
  if (-1 != result)
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) result;
  else
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#elif defined(_WIN32)
  SYSTEM_INFO si;
  GetSystemInfo (&si);
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) si.dwPageSize;
#else
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#endif /* _WIN32 */
  mhd_assert (0 == (MHD_sys_page_size_ % ALIGN_SIZE));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_init_mem_pools_:
#define MHD_SC_PAGESIZE _SC_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_ _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation — ALIGN_SIZE expands to (2*sizeof(void *)), which is a compile-time positive integer (>=2). The macro itself does not introduce any conditional or unreachable code paths (it’s just a constant expression used, e.g., in a modulo check). There is no unreachable code produced by this definition, so MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is not violated.
